Abstract: This study investigates the Q-measure dynamics of forward rates, focusing on their volatility and correlation structures within a no-arbitrage framework. We develop a novel pricing model that incorporates time-varying volatility and correlation patterns observed in empirical forward rate data. Our approach extends existing term structure models by introducing a flexible parameterization of the forward rate covariance matrix. We demonstrate that this enhanced model significantly improves the accuracy of interest rate derivative pricing and hedging strategies. Furthermore, we provide empirical evidence supporting the model's superiority in capturing market dynamics compared to traditional approaches. Our findings have important implications for risk management and monetary policy analysis in fixed-income markets.
